KnowledgeBase.Title: isMember
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: Structure Dictionary Directory Symbol Boolean Structure Dictionary Directory Symbol Boolean Structure Dictionary Directory Symbol Boolean Character String Symbol Vector BitVector ByteVector IntVector ShortVector FltVector ObjVector Structure Dictionary Directory Matrix NumMatrix Integer Float Number Complex Boolean
KnowledgeBase.DataType: Structure Dictionary Directory Vector Matrix Pair List NumMatrix ShortVector IntVector NumVector ObjVector BitVector

Function.Description:
The isMember function determines whether or not the specified key is a member of the Structure, Dictionary or Directory. If the key is found, true is returned. If key is not found, false is returned.

The isMember function determines whether or not the specified key is a member of the Structure, Dictionary or Directory. If the key is found, true is returned. If key is not found, false is returned.

The isMember function determines whether or not the specified key is a member of the Structure, Dictionary or Directory. If the key is found, true is returned. If key is not found, false is returned.

The isMember function determines whether or not the specified object is a member of the Vector. If the object is found, true is returned. If object is not found, false is returned.

The isMember function determines whether or not the specified object object is a member of the Matrix. If the object is found, true is returned. If the object is not found, false is returned.

The isMember function determines whether or not the specified object object is a member of the NumMatrix. If the object is found, true is returned. If the object is not found, false is returned.

The isMember function determines whether or not the specified object object is a member of the target Pair. If the object is found, true is returned. If the object is not found, false is returned.

The isMember function determines whether or not the specified object object is a member of the target List. If the object is found, true is returned. If the object is not found, false is returned.

Brief.Overview-Structure: The isMember function determines whether or not the specified key {key} is a member of the {target} Structure. If the {key} is found, true is returned. If {key} is not found, false is returned. The isMember function uses the isEqual predicate.
Brief.Overview-Dictionary: The isMember function determines whether or not the specified key {key} is a member of the {target} Dictionary. If the {key} is found, true is returned. If {key} is not found, false is returned. The isMember function uses the isEqual predicate.
Brief.Overview-Directory: The isMember function determines whether or not the specified key {key} is a member of the {target} Directory. If the {key} is found, true is returned. If {key} is not found, false is returned. The isMember function uses the isEqual predicate.
Brief.Overview: The isMember function determines whether or not the specified object {obj} is a member of the {target} Vector. If the {obj} is found, true is returned. If {obj} is not found, false is returned. The isMember function uses the isEqual predicate.
Brief.Overview-Matrix: The isMember function determines whether or not the specified object {obj} is a member of the {target} Matrix. If the {obj} is found, true is returned. If {obj} is not found, false is returned. The isMember function uses the isEqual predicate.
Brief.Overview-NumMatrix: The isMember function determines whether or not the specified object {obj} is a member of the {target} NumMatrix. If the {obj} is found, true is returned. If {obj} is not found, false is returned. The isMember function uses the isEqual predicate.
Brief.Overview-Pair: The isMember function determines whether or not the specified object {obj} is a member of the {target} Pair or List. If the {obj} is found, true is returned. If {obj} is not found, false is returned. The isMember function uses the isEqual predicate.
Brief.Usage-Structure: The isMember function is used to determine if a symbolic key is in a specified Structure. It returns a Boolean value true if found in the Structure or false if not found. If the desired information is the index of the symbolic key, then the member function should be used instead
Brief.Usage-Dictionary: The isMember function is used to determine if a symbolic key is in a specified Dictionary. It returns a Boolean value true if found in the Dictionary or false if not found. If the desired information is the index of the symbolic key, then the member function should be used instead
Brief.Usage-Directory: The isMember function is used to determine if a symbolic key is in a specified Directory. It returns a Boolean value true if found in the Directory or false if not found. If the desired information is the index of the symbolic key, then the member function should be used instead
Brief.Usage: The isMember function is used to determine if an object is in the Vector It returns a Boolean value true if found in the Vector or false if not found. If the desired information is the index of the object, then the member function should be used instead
Brief.Usage-Matrix:
Note: Returns an error message if the Matrix is not of rank one.

The isMember function is used to determine if an object is in the Matrix It returns a Boolean value true if found in the Matrix or false if not found. If the desired information is the index of the object, then the member function should be used instead
Brief.Usage-NumMatrix:
Note: Returns an error message if the NumMatrix is not of rank one.

The isMember function is used to determine if an object is in the NumMatrix It returns a Boolean value true if found in the Matrix or false if not found. If the desired information is the index of the object, then the member function should be used instead
Brief.Usage-Pair: The isMember function is used to determine if an object is in the Pair or List It returns a Boolean value true if found in the Pair or List or false if not found. If the desired information is the index of the object, then the member function should be used instead
Brief.Usage-List: The isMember function is used to determine if an object is in the List It returns a Boolean value true if found in the List or false if not found. If the desired information is the index of the object, then the member function should be used instead

Argument.Name: key
Argument.Note: The key to search for (it must be a symbol).

Syntax-Structure.Return: Returns true if the key was found. Returns false if the key was not found.
